Description Text:
This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR subpart 12.6 and part 13, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotations are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. Solicitation number 70Z03825QB0000125 is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ). This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 2025-04 Effective June 11, 2025.

The applicable North American Industry Classification Standard Code is 336413. The small business size standard is 1,250 employees. This is a Total Small Business Set-Aside requirement. All responsible sources may submit a quotation which shall be considered by the agency.

It is anticipated that a firm-fixed price purchase order will be awarded as a Total Small Business Set-Aside as a result of this synopsis/solicitation. All parts must have clear traceability to the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM), Bureau Normalisation Aeronautique Espace (Cage Code F0111). Traceability means a clear, complete, documented, and auditable paper trail which traces each step from an OEM approved source.

See attached documents titled:

“Requirements - 70Z03825QB0000125” and

“Terms and Conditions – 70Z03825QB0000125”. 



52.217-6 Option for Increased Quantity (MAR 1989) applies to this acquisition and is tailored as follows:

The Government may increase the quantity of supplies called for in the Schedule, by up to a quantity of Five Thousand (5,000), at the unit price specified, up to a maximum quantity of Ten Thousand (10,000). The Contracting Officer may exercise the option by written notice to the Contractor within one calendar year after Purchase Order award. Delivery of the added items shall continue at the same rate as the like items call for under the Purchase Order, unless the parties otherwise agree.

***Please note that if the USCG chooses to exercise any optional quantity modification, such modifications will be issued unilaterally to the contractor.

(End of Clause)

Alternate part numbers will be accepted. Concerns having the expertise and required capabilities to provide these items are invited to submit offers in accordance with the requirements stipulated in this solicitation. Parts must be approved in accordance with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) guidelines to ensure safety of our aircrew. The Government shall ensure all procurements are awarded without jeopardizing quality or safety of flight. Only the use of airworthy commercial specifications or standard military specifications/military standard parts will be utilized and approved from this solicitation.

Newly manufactured commercial items will only be procured from sources able to provide a Certificate of Conformance (COC) and traceability to the OEM. The Federal Aviation Regulation, Part 21, outlines certification procedures.

NOTE: NO DRAWINGS, SPECIFICATIONS OR SCHEMATICS ARE AVAILABLE FROM THIS AGENCY.

Closing date and time for receipt of offers is 30 July 2025 at 9:00 am EDT. Quotes and questions shall be submitted by email to Selmary.MelendezGonzalez3@uscg.mil. Please indicate solicitation 70Z03825QB0000125 in the subject line. Phone call quotes WILL NOT be accepted.

Quoters shall submit their quote to the Purchasing Agent Harkley, Heather at heather.harkley@usda.gov and a courtesy copy to Contracting Officer, Rivera gonzalez, Nestor at nestor.riveragonzalez@usda.gov.

This Sources Sought Notice is issued for information and planning purposes only as part of U.S. Department of State market research and does not constitute an RFP. The purpose of this notice is to obtain information regarding the availability and capability of qualified Small Business (SB), Women Owned Small Business (WOSB), HUBZone (HUBZ), 8(a), and Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) - (SDVOSM) under NAICS code 541330. The government is requesting information regarding the availability of capable firms to support the requirements of the U.S. Department of State (DOS), Bureau of Overseas Buildings Operations (OBO) for indefinite delivery/indefinite quantity (IDIQ) contracts to qualified architect and engineer (A/E) firm-led teams (prime or joint venture) of licensed professionals to provide comprehensive A/E services.

Description Text:
The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Fisheries, Midwater Assessment and Conservation Engineering (MACE) program intends to post a solicitation for the design and lease of Advanced small stereo-cameras on SAM.gov. A Performance Work Statement (PWS) will be included in the Request for Proposal (RFP).



The proposed contract action is set aside 100% for small businesses. It is highly encouraged that any small business meeting the NAICS code 334511 size standard and desiring to be considered for award be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) using this NAICS code or a NAICS code with an equivalent size standard. It should be noted that offerors must be registered in SAM prior to submission of an offer. For additional information and to register in SAM, please access the following web site: https://sam.gov/. In order to register with the SAM, all offerors must also have a unique entity identifier through http://sam.gov/conent/entity-registration.



Solicitation documents will be made available for download on or about August 01, 2025 at https://sam.gov/. Paper copies of this solicitation will not be issued. Interested parties may use the “follow” feature to monitor changes to this notice, including Request for Proposal (RFP) posting as well as all postings of information associated with this solicitation thereafter. Each potential offeror is responsible for checking https://sam.gov/ to gain all current information related to the solicitation. The solicitation and any further announcements regarding the solicitation will be posted only at https://sam.gov/.  The date offers are due will be stated within the solicitation documents and will be adjusted based upon the actual release date of the solicitation. All questions of any nature regarding this procurement should be sent in writing to the Contract Specialist, Rachel Stone at Rachel.stone@noaa.gov.



(End of Document)

Description Text:
THIS REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (RFI)/SOURCES SOUGHT

DISCLAIMER

1. This RFI is issued solely for information and planning purposes only and does not constitute a solicitation. All information received in response to this RFI that is marked as proprietary will be handled accordingly. Responses to this notice are not offers and cannot be accepted by the Government to form a binding contract. Responders are solely responsible for all expenses associated with responding to this RFI.

2. The submission of pricing, capabilities for planning purposes, and other market information is highly encouraged and allowed under this RFI In Accordance With (IAW) FAR Part 15.201(e).

SOURCES SOUGHT DESCRIPTION: See attached Statement of Work. 

3. This is NOT a solicitation announcement. This is a RFI/sources sought only. The purpose of this sources sought/RFI is to gain knowledge of potential qualified sources and their size classification relative to NAICS 541330. Responses to this sources sought will be used by the Government to make appropriate acquisition decisions. After review of the responses to this sources sought, a solicitation announcement may be published. Responses to this sources sought synopsis are not considered adequate responses for a solicitation announcement. 

4. The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), VISN 15 Network Contracting Office, is seeking sources that can provide the following:
 
Contractor shall provide to the Kansas City VA Medical Center (KCVAMC) an on-site field survey consisting of identifying and creating an inventory of all equipment subject to hazardous energy control procedures as determined by 29 CFR 1910.147, 29 CFR 1910 Subpart S (OSHA s Electrical standards), VHA Directive 1028, and KCVAMC guidelines.


5. It is the responsibility of the interested source to demonstrate to the government that the interested parties can provide the services that fulfill the requirement. If you are interested and are capable of providing the sought-out services, please provide the requested information as well as the information indicated below. Failure to respond to all questions in this sources sought will determine the interested party as non-responsive which may affect a set-aside decision for a resulting solicitation.  Response to this notice should include company name, address, point of contact, size of business pursuant to the following questions: 


a. Please provide your UEI number.

b. Please indicate the size status and representations of your business, such as but not limited to: Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), Veteran Owned Small Business (VOSB), Hubzone, Woman Owned Small Business (WOSB), Large Business, etc.)?


c. Is your company considered small under the NAICS code identified under this RFI?



d. If you are identified as a SDVOSB/VOSB or SB, identify how you intend to meet the requirements found in the limitations on subcontracting FAR or VAAR clauses. (providing 51% of the work outlined in section 4 above): Fill out attached Self Performance Worksheet.


e. Please submit your capabilities that show clear, compelling, and convincing evidence that you can meet the requirement described above. 

6. Responses to this notice shall be submitted via email to Laura Ferguson at Laura.Ferguson@va.gov. Telephone responses shall not be accepted. Responses must be received no later than Wednesday, July 30, 2025, at 1700 CST. If a solicitation is issued it shall be announced at a later date, and all interested parties must respond to that solicitation announcement separately from the responses to this sources sought. Responses to this sources sought notice are not a request to be added to a prospective bidders list or to receive a copy of the solicitation.

Description Text:
***NOAA'S PACIFIC MARINE ENVIRONMENTAL LABORATORY (PMEL) INTENDS TO NEGOTIATE, ON A SOLE SOURCE BASIS, UNDER AUTHORITY OF FAR 13.106-1(b)(1), WITH TELEDYNE RD INSTRUMENTS OUT OF POWAY, CA FOR THE ACOUSTIC DOPPLER CURRENT PROFILER (ADCP) WHSII300 WORKHORSE.



******THE SOLE SOURCE DETERMINATION IS BASED ON COMPATIBILITY TO EXISTING SYSTEMS OR EQUIPMENT – THE REQUIRED SUPPLIES OR SERVICE MUST BE COMPATIBLE IN ALL ASPECTS (FORM, FIT, AND FUNCTION) WITH EXISTING SYSTEMS OR EQUIPMENT AND THE SOURCE IS UNIQUELY QUALIFIED TO MEET NOAA’S REQUIREMENT. TELEDYNE IS THE SOLE ENTITY IN THE UNITED STATES THAT CAN MEET AND PROVIDE THE REQUIRED WHSII300 WORKHORSE. THE ECOSYSTEM & FISHERIES-OCEANOGRAPHY COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS (EcoFOCI) PROGRAM AT NOAA PMEL HAS RELIED ON TELEDYNE RD INSTRUMENTS ACOUSTIC DOPPLER CURRENT PROFILERS (ADCPs) FOR DECADES TO COLLECT CURRENT VELOCITY DATA ACROSS THE BERING AND CHUKCHI SEAS. THESE INSTRUMENTS HAVE DEMONSTRATED LONG-TERM ACCURACY AND RELIABILITY, AND THE PROGRAM HAS INVESTED EXTENSIVELY IN DEPLOYMENT INFRASTRUCTURE AND DATA PROCESSING SYSTEMS TAILORED SPECIFICALLY TO TELEDYNE ADCPs. CONTINUED USE OF THIS BRAND ENSURES SEAMLESS INTEGRATION AND MAINTAINS DATA QUALITY. THE REQUIRED DELIVERY DATE IS BY 10/01/2025.

***THIS NOTICE OF INTENT IS NOT A REQUEST FOR COMPETITIVE PROPOSALS AND NO SOLICITATION PACKAGE IS AVAILABLE. HOWEVER, FIRMS THAT BELIEVE THEY CAN FULLY MEET THE GOVERNMENT'S REQUIREMENTS MAY SUBMIT SUBSTANTIATING DOCUMENTATION IN WRITING TO THE IDENTIFIED POINT OF CONTACT WITHIN 15 DAYS AFTER PUBLICATION OF THIS SYNOPSIS. SUCH DOCUMENTATION WILL BE EVALUATED SOLELY FOR THE PURPOSE OF DETERMINING WHETHER OR NOT TO CONDUCT THIS PROCUREMENT ON A COMPETITIVE BASIS. A DETERMINATION BY THE GOVERNMENT NOT TO CONDUCT A COMPETITIVE PROCUREMENT, BASED UPON RESPONSES TO THIS NOTICE, IS SOLELY WITHIN THE DISCRETION OF THE GOVERNMENT. ORAL COMMUNICATIONS ARE NOT ACCEPTABLE IN RESPONSE TO THIS NOTICE.
NAICS Title: Search, Detection, Navigation, Guidance, Aeronautical, and Nautical System and Instrument Manufacturing

Description Text:
This procurement action is being conducted under the authority of  41 U.S. Code 1901 in conjunction with 41 U.S. Code 3304(a)(1) and as described in Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) 13.501(a) and 6.302-1.  The solocitation is prepared in accordance with FAR Subpart 12.6, Streamlined Procedures for Evaluation and Solicitation for Commercial Items, in conjunction with the policies and procedures for solicitation, evaluation, and award as prescribed in FAR 13, Simplified Acquisition Procedures.  The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code is 334511 with an industry size standard of 1,350 employees and the associated Product Service Code (PSC) is 6675.

This Notice of Intent is not a request for Proposals or Quotations.  No solicitation document exists, and no telephone or email inquiries will be accepted.  No contract award will be made based on proposals, or quotations received in response to this notice.  Interested persons may identify their interest and capability to respond to the requirement and should furnish detailed data concerning their capabilities to provide services sought including pricing data and technical data sufficient to determine that a comparable source to the government is available. The government may consider all “Expression of Interest” documentation received prior to 8/05/2025.  A determination by the government not to compete this proposed contract based upon responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the government. Information received will normally be considered for the sole purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement.  Responses to this notice must be emailed to WFL.Purchasing@dot.gov and received by Tuesday, 8/05/2025, at 2:00pm PT . Submitters are responsible for ensuring their email reaches the designated contracting officer on-time.

Solicitation Title: R499-- Radiation Oncology Shielding Design Technical Review  and Training
Description Text:
35C25625Q1022

This Combined Synopsis/ Solicitation Notice is amended to:
 Extend the closing date for responses from July 21, 2025 to 8:00 AM Central Standard Time on July 25, 2025

Answer vendor questions.

Question 1.  Will the requested training consist of a formal course of seminar type training with power point presentations, Q&A, and in-depth review of NCRP 151 and the formal review of provided shielding analysis and Radiation Survey report reviews? 

Answer 1.   Yes. That is preferable. Initial basic training and as the years progress, review and case studies.

Question 2.  Who will be trained and how often will this training be held?

Answer 2.  VHA National Health Physics Program Managers. Currently there are 5 program managers. All are Health Physicists. Training held on location one or two times per year. Training location TBD, although one location is Little Rock, Arkansas. Â Some training can be accomplished virtually.


NOTE:  Please reference Solicitation Number 36C25625Q1022 in the subject line of your email response.

Solicitation Title: Repair Elevator Equippd RH for the Support of the HC-144 Aircraft
Description Text:
This Special Notice constitutes the only solicitation. A written solicitation will not be issued. Solicitation Number 70Z03825QL0000130 is issued as a Special Notice of Intent to Award to Airbus DS Military Aircraft, Inc. (Cage Code 0DAF1), for the Repair of one (1) Rudder Assy and one (1) Elevator Equipd LH to support the HC-144 Aircraft:

NSN                                  Part Number                        Nomenclature                QTY

1560-33-001-9887          35-32001-0009              Elevator Equippd RH                  1



All items must be repaired in accordance with (IAW) Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM), specifications to include the latest revisions, updates and service bulletins. The OEM for this item is Airbus Defence and Space SAU, (Cage Code 0117B).  



Any vendor, except the OEM or a Production Approval Holder (PAH), repairing/overhauling/modifying Coast Guard aircraft components MUST be FAA 145 certified and perform at least fifty percent (50%) of the work at their company’s FAA certified facility. Unless otherwise instructed by the Contracting Officer, awards for the repair or overhaul of Coast Guard aircraft repairable components shall only be awarded directly to service vendors who have been deemed fully capable of performing such services by division level command-appointed Coast Guard Engineers or Equipment Specialists. Vendors who do not meet the above stated capability requirement will not be considered and should not respond to this solicitation/ request for quote (RFQ).



Incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2025-04 effective June 11, 2025. The applicable North American Industry Classification Standard (NAICS) Code is 488190.  The small business size standard is $40M.



The following attachments apply to this solicitation:

Attachment A – Terms and Conditions

Attachment B – Statement of Work

Attachment C – Redacted Justification for Other Than Full and Open Competition



It is anticipated that a Sole Source Purchase Order will be awarded as a result of this notice pending the availability of funds. It is the Government’s belief that Airbus DS Military Aircraft, Inc. is the only potential source with access to the required proprietary technical and engineering data to provide the repair of the above identified parts. Concerns having the expertise and required capabilities to provide these parts are invited to submit complete information discussing the same within ten (10) calendar days from this posting. Vendors who do not meet the capability requirement will not be considered. The notice of intent will not be extended or the award delayed for a vendor to submit their data for capability determination or for registration in SAM.gov.



Please note: Only quotations with shipping terms of F.O.B. Destination or F.O.B Origin will be accepted. Shipping terms of Ex Works (EXW) or Incoterms 2020 (to include but not limited to DAP Incoterms 2020 and FCA, Incoterms 2020) will not be accepted.



The closing date for this intent to award notice is July 28, 2025 at 4:00 pm EST.  Point of contact for this intent to award notice is Allison.T.Meads@uscg.mil. Please indicate 70Z03825QL0000130 in the subject line.
NAICS Title: Other Support Activities for Air Transportation
PSC Description: Maintenance, Repair and Rebuilding of Equipment: Aircraft Components and Accessories

Description Text:
This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR subpart 12.6 and part 13, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotations are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. Solicitation number 70Z03825QB0000121 is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ). This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 2025-04 Effective June 11, 2025.

The applicable North American Industry Classification Standard Code is 336413. The small business size standard is 1,250 employees. This is a restricted requirement. All responsible sources may submit a quotation which shall be considered by the agency. 

It is anticipated that a firm-fixed price purchase order will be awarded on a brand name basis as a result of this synopsis/solicitation. All parts must have clear traceability to the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM), Kulite Semiconductor Products Inc (Cage Code 34345). Traceability means a clear, complete, documented, and auditable paper trail which traces each step from an OEM or approved source. 

See attached documents titled: 
“Requirements – 70Z03825QB0000121,” 
“Terms and Conditions – 70Z03825QB0000121”, and 
“Redacted J and A – 70Z03825QB0000121.” 

52.217-6 Option for Increased Quantity (MAR 1989) applies to this acquisition and is tailored 
as follows:
The Government may increase the quantity of supplies called for in the Schedule, by up to a quantity of Twelve (12), at the unit price specified, up to a maximum quantity of Eighteen (18). The Contracting Officer may exercise the option by written notice to the Contractor within one calendar year after Purchase Order award. Delivery of the added items shall continue at the same rate as the like items call for under the Purchase Order, unless the parties otherwise agree. 
***Please note that if the USCG chooses to exercise any optional quantity modification, such modifications will be issued unilaterally to the contractor. 
(End of Clause) 

Concerns having the expertise and required capabilities to provide these items are invited to  submit offers in accordance with the requirements stipulated in this solicitation. Parts must be approved in accordance with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) guidelines to ensure safety of our aircrew. The Government shall ensure all procurements are awarded without jeopardizing quality or safety of flight.

No alternate part numbers will be accepted. Parts must be approved in accordance with Federal  Aviation Administration (FAA) guidelines to ensure safety of our aircrew. Best value to the  Government is always the goal, but without jeopardizing quality or safety of flight. Only the use  of airworthy commercial specifications or standard military specifications/military standard parts will be utilized and approved from this solicitation. 

Newly manufactured commercial items will only be procured from sources able to provide a  certificate of conformance (COC). The  Federal Aviation Regulation, Part 21, outlines  certification procedures. 

NOTE: NO DRAWINGS, SPECIFICATIONS OR SCHEMATICS ARE AVAILABLE FROM THIS AGENCY. 

Closing date and time for receipt of offers is 30 July 2025 at 9:00am EDT. Quotes and questions shall be submitted by email to Selmary.MelendezGonzalez3@uscg.mil. Please indicate solicitation 70Z03825QB0000121 in the subject line. Phone call quotes WILL NOT be accepted.

Solicitation Title: HIGH ALTITUDE, LONG DURATION UAS FLIGHT SERVICES OVER WILDLAND FIRES
Description Text:
Synopsis:



NASA/NSSC has a requirement for HIGH ALTITUDE, LONG DURATION UAS FLIGHT SERVICES OVER WILDLAND FIRES. 

NASA/NSSC intends to issue a sole source contract to AMERICAN AEROSPACE TECHNOLOGIES, INC. 14 Union Hill RD STE 100 Conshohocken, Pennsylvania 19428-2727 United States under the authority of FAR 13.106-1(b)(1)(i). It has been determined that AMERICAN AEROSPACE TECHNOLOGIES, INC. is the sole provider of high altitude, long duration UAS flight services over wildland fires.

NASA/NSSC will be the procuring center for this effort.  Performance will be located at NASA/ Langley Research Center (LARC).

The Government intends to acquire commercial items and services using the provisions, clauses and procedures prescribed in FAR Part 12 and FAR Part 13.



The NAICS Code for this procurement is 488190



Interested organizations may submit their capabilities and qualifications to perform the effort in writing to the identified point of contact not later than 12 p.m. Central Standard Time on 7/24/2025. Such capabilities/qualifications will be evaluated solely for the purpose of determining whether or not to conduct this procurement on a competitive basis. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed effort on a full and open competition basis, based upon responses to this notice, is solely within the discretion of the government.



Oral communications are not acceptable in response to this notice.



NASA Clause 1852.215-84, Ombudsman, is applicable. The Center Ombudsman for this acquisition can be found at http://prod.nais.nasa.gov/pub/pub_library/Omb.html .

Solicitation Title: 52000SP50020320 CGC TAHOMA MK39 GYRO CIRCUIT CARD OPEN AND INSPECT
Description Text:
NOTICE OF INTENT TO AWARD UNITED STATES COAST GUARD SFLC NORFOLK INTENDS TO AWARD an order for an open and inspect of OEM MK39 A5 Circuit Card (Northrop Grumman Systems Corporation). This notice is to inform companies of the Government intent to award. If a company demonstrates the capability to open, inspect and execute the necessary repairs, the Government may use the response for information and planning purposes.  The purpose of the Notice of Intent is to inform sources of the Government intent to award to a company claiming sole source, this does not constitute an RFQ. The Government does not intend to award a contract based on responses to this Notice of Intent. All information received in response to this Notice of Intent marked "Proprietary" will be protected and handled accordingly. Interested parties are responsible for adequately marking proprietary or competition sensitive information contained in their response. The Government reserves the right to ask follow-up clarifying questions to individual companies based on proprietary information submitted without posting those questions.

The Government requests that parties capable of meeting the supply demand respond to this notice in writing including details of your company’s ability to supply the requested part from the attached (SOW) Statement of Work. Please provide the following information: Company Name and Address Cage Code UEI Number Company business size by NAICS code Small Business Type(s), if applicable Point of Contact for questions and/or clarifications Telephone Number and email address Web Page URL (if applicable) Teaming Partners (if applicable) Provide documents showing the services are equivalent to Northrop Grumman Corporation. Information regarding the viability to receive and process classified information with appropriate contact information. Provide any recommendations and/or concerns. Do not submit pricing information in response to this Notice of Intent.  Please send responses  with the subject heading: CGC Tahoma MK39 A5 Circuit Card to SKC Karla Balint at karla.p.balint@uscg.mil by Thursday, July 24th, 2025 NLT 0900 A.M. EST. The information in this notice is current as of the publication date but is subject to change and is not binding to the Government.  Oral submissions of information are not acceptable.

Solicitation Title: RFQ for Protective Cover for a Robertson Fuel Systems Fuel Tank
Description Text:
The General Services Administration, Office of General Supplies and Services (GSS) Supply Chain Management Contracting Division, is posting a Request for Quote (RFQ) for Part Number FT800G-H47-001 or Equal. Vendors quoting must be registered to receive Purchase Orders via EDI or through OMS Vendor Portal. Please see the salient characteristics description detailing the manufacturer and part number requested. All delivery locations will be within the Continental United States and shipments must be compliant with MIL-STD-129 marking and labeling. Some shipments may be shipped through consolidation points, for ultimate OCONUS consignee. MIL-STD-129 must be adhered to prevent frustrated shipments. See the RFQ for delivery city and zip code, however, full delivery addresses will be provided on awarded Purchase Orders. Prices are requested on a FOB Destination basis with the vendor’s best delivery lead time. This solicitation is not a small business set-aside.

A vendor meeting all administrative compliance requirements in Section 3 of the RFQ (submitted by the solicitation close date and time) will move forward to the final evaluation factor: Low Price.

If any required documents are not submitted or required field left blank on pages 1 - 5 of the RFQ document including the Section 3 questions or if the completion of required clauses and provision fill-ins are not made (as applicable), further consideration for award will not be made.

Both RFQ and MIL-STD-129R forms are attached to the RFQ posting on SAM.gov. 

** These documents MUST be returned.

1. RFQ


	Pages 1 to 5 Fully Completed and Signed, along with any necessary provisions. 
	Fully address ALL requirements marked with an (x) in Sections 1, 2, and 3 
	Please sign and date on page 5.
	Please ensure ALL required questions are answered completely. 


2. MIL-STD-129R


	Sign on page 8 and return the entire MIL-STD-129R document, if your company does not have a completed form on file for the Instaquote Program. 


Please find attached the RFQ and MIL-STD-129 forms. Please contact erin.ji@gsa.gov with any questions.

Amendment #1

The closing date has been extended until Wednesday, July 23, 2025 at 5:00 PM EDT. Please make sure that all questions in Sections 1 through 3 of the RFQ are answered completely. In addition, please answer the question on page 16 of the RFQ and other sections if applicable.

Solicitation Title: C1DA--626A4-25-201 - AE Upgrade Primary Power Distribution
Description Text:
626A4-25-201 - 36C24925R0037 - AE Upgrade Primary Power Distribution
Responses to RFIs:

The Statement of Work is good but since this is an upgrade to the existing facilities, do you have 1-line/as-built drawings that we can use in our bid preparation?
A: Please see attached one-line drawings for existing conditions. The DWG file is the overall campus one line. The PDF shows a co-generator that was added to the campus power. There seems to be some discrepancies in the one-lines, so the AE s need to keep that in mind.

A site walk would also go a long way in assisting us with pricing.
A: No, site visit will not be provided since this is an AE Design. No fee proposal shall be needed until after evaluation has been made on the provided SF330.

Page 3 says PPQs will count towards the page limitations but there is no mention of the page limit anywhere else. Is there a page limit for the SF330 submission?
A: Size:Â  Maximum size of the e-mail message shall not exceed five (5) megabytes. Only one email is permitted unless otherwise stated in this paragraph or in writing by a Contracting Officer. Submitted SF330 s are not to exceed a total of fifty (50) pages INCLUDING cover page and any other submitted documents.

Does the VA have a list of which disciplines firms should provide resumes for in Section E?
A: Yes, see page 5 of SF 330 

Does the VA have a minimum or maximum number of projects they want firms to submit in Section F?
A: Yes, the AE should provide 3-5 relevant projects for this section.

Can you please confirm that we only need to provide VA projects awarded in the previous 12 months and the full potential value of any current indefinite delivery contracts for the prime A-E and not for our proposed subcontractors?
A: Provide the available capacity of key disciplines by providing current project workload, inclusive of all projects awarded by the VA during the previous 12 months and the full potential value of any current indefinite delivery contracts.

Can you please confirm we are not required to submit CPARS with our submission, only PPQs if CPARS are not available for the project?
A: CPARS to be submitted, if there is no CPARS data available, Past Performance Questionnaires (PPQs) will be accepted.

Can you please confirm that the geographical location of the firm is not an evaluation consideration of Factor 5 (Location)? Page 4 states  location in the general geographical area of the project  but then states that the intent is  not where the firm is located.  This paragraph also refers to Secondary Selection Criteria Factor 1, where information related to the firm s location is to be addressed, but there is no paragraph or subcategory for Secondary Selection Criteria in the RFQ.
A: Geographical location of the firm is not an evaluation consideration, however, intent of this factor is to showcase a firm s understanding of the site and locality, and not where the firm is located. Firm s location to be addressed is to determine what Wage Determination to extract from SAM.gov.

Would you consider cancelling this solicitation and re-issuing it through the IDIQ AE MATOC TVHS-Nashville and Murfreesboro that was awarded in September 2024? This vehicle has not yet been used to solicit responses to RFQs and seems to be a perfect fit for this project. 
A: No

Thanks for any insight you can give as to why this vehicle is not being used.
A: CONSTRUCTION BUDGET DESIGN LIMITATIONS/PROJECT MAGNITUDE: Estimated Budget Between $5,000,000.00 and $10,000,000.00.

Can you please clarify if PDFs are an acceptable format for the 626A4-25-201 - 36C24925R0037 - AE Upgrade Primary Power Distribution SF330s to be submitted?Â 
A: Yes, PDFs are acceptable.

Can you please also confirm the page limitations?
A: Size:Â  Maximum size of the e-mail message shall not exceed five (5) megabytes. Only one email is permitted unless otherwise stated in this paragraph or in writing by a Contracting Officer. Submitted SF330 s are not to exceed a total of fifty (50) pages INCLUDING cover page and any other submitted documents.

The U.S. Department of Transportation, Volpe Center (U.S. DOT Volpe Center) in Cambridge, MA has a requirement for the following services in accordance with the attached Performance Work Statement (PWS) (Attachment 1).

Quotes shall be submitted by 12:00 noon Eastern Standard Time on August 8, 2025.

Questions may be submitted to Kayla Kuta at Kayla.Kuta@dot.gov no later than July 25, 2025, for review and Government response.

Solicitation Title: CARBON DIOXIDE REMOVAL BY IONIC LIQUID SYSTEM FOR MOBILITY (CDRILS-M)
Description Text:
NASA is currently seeking industry partners who are capable of providing the following requirement: The Carbon Dioxide Removal by Ionic Liquid System for Mobility (CDRILS-M) is being developed for NASA's Mars Exploration Extravehicular Mobility Unit (mxEMU) to provide continuous CO2 and humidity control using a liquid sorbent, which offers non-venting EVA capability, trace contaminant removal, and improved serviceability. This system aims to integrate with the vehicle's Environmental Control and Life Support System (ECLSS) to enhance mission efficiency and reduce maintenance requirements.
The requirement is being considered for a sole source award to a known source; however any protentional capable industry partners are encouraged to respond with a capability statement. NASA is particularly interested in hearing from small businesses of any socioeconomic catagory. Any interested company shall provide a capability statement that indicates how the company is capable of meeting this requirement. The response shall also provide at least one past performance reference that is of a similar complexity and magnitude.

“Requirements - 70Z03825QB0000115” and

“Terms and Conditions – 70Z03825QB0000115”. 

52.217-6 Option for Increased Quantity (MAR 1989) applies to this acquisition and is tailored as follows:

The Government may increase the quantity of supplies called for in the Schedule, by up to a quantity of Ten (10), at the unit price specified, up to a maximum quantity of Thirty (30).  The Contracting Officer may exercise the option by written notice to the Contractor within one calendar year after Purchase Order award.  Delivery of the added items shall continue at the same rate as the like items call for under the Purchase Order, unless the parties otherwise agree.

***Please note that if the USCG chooses to exercise any optional quantity modification, such modifications will be issued unilaterally to the contractor.

(End of Clause)

Alternate part numbers will be accepted. Concerns having the expertise and required capabilities to provide these items are invited to submit offers in accordance with the requirements stipulated in this solicitation.  Parts must be approved in accordance with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) guidelines to ensure safety of our aircrew.  The Government shall ensure all procurements are awarded without jeopardizing quality or safety of flight.  Only the use of airworthy commercial specifications or standard military specifications/military standard parts will be utilized and approved from this solicitation. 

Newly manufactured commercial items will only be procured from sources able to provide a Certificate of Conformance (COC) and traceability to the OEM.  The Federal Aviation Regulation, Part 21, outlines certification procedures. 

NOTE: NO DRAWINGS, SPECIFICATIONS OR SCHEMATICS ARE AVAILABLE FROM THIS AGENCY.

Closing date and time for receipt of offers is 25 July 2025 at 9:00am EST.  Quotes and questions shall be submitted by email to hartley.k.askew2@uscg.mil.  Please indicate solicitation 70Z03825QB0000115 in the subject line. Phone call quotes WILL NOT be accepted.

Description Text:
This Special Notice constitutes the only solicitation. A written solicitation will not be issued. Solicitation Number 70Z03825QW0000101 is issued as a Special Notice of Intent to Award to Leonardo SpA (Cage Code A1512), for the Repair/Modification of the below parts to support the HC-27J Aircraft:

NSN                                             Part Number              Nomenclature                                         QTY

1680-15-200-8013                       SM2726                        Valve, Solenoid                                          4
Modify To                                      Modify To
4810-15-198-0885                      SM2726-1

4330-15-059-0651                       SM2407A                      Filter Assembly                                            2



At the time of award, the USCG intends to have four (4) repairs/modifications completed for the components/items specified in line 1.  IAW Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) 52.217-6 the USCG may require additional repairs for up to six (6) components/items for a maximum quantity of ten (10) at the same price as the original order, for up to three hundred and sixty-five (365) after the initial award date.



**Please note that if the USCG chooses to exercise any optional quantity modifications, such modifications will be issued unilaterally to the contractor.  



All items must be repaired in accordance with (IAW) Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM), specifications to include the latest revisions, updates and service bulletins. The OEM for these items is Secondo Mona Spa, (Cage Code A0303). 


Any vendor, except the OEM or a Production Approval Holder (PAH), repairing/overhauling/modifying Coast Guard aircraft components MUST be FAA 145 certified and perform at least fifty percent (50%) of the work at their company’s FAA certified facility. Unless otherwise instructed by the Contracting Officer, awards for the repair or overhaul of Coast Guard aircraft repairable components shall only be awarded directly to service vendors who have been deemed fully capable of performing such services by division level command-appointed Coast Guard Engineers or Equipment Specialists. Vendors who do not meet the above stated capability requirement will not be considered and should not respond to this solicitation/ request for quote (RFQ).



Incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2025-04 effective June 11, 2025. The applicable North American Industry Classification Standard (NAICS) Code is 488190.  The small business size standard is $40M.



The following attachments apply to this solicitation:

Attachment A – Terms and Conditions

Attachment B – Statement of Work

Attachment C – Redacted Justification for Other Than Full and Open Competition



It is anticipated that a Sole Source Purchase Order will be awarded as a result of this notice pending the availability of funds. It is the Government’s belief that Leonardo SpA is the only potential source with access to the required proprietary technical and engineering data to provide the repair of the above identified parts. Concerns having the expertise and required capabilities to provide these parts are invited to submit complete information discussing the same within ten (10) calendar days from this posting. Vendors who do not meet the capability requirement will not be considered. The notice of intent will not be extended or the award delayed for a vendor to submit their data for capability determination or for registration in SAM.gov.



Please note: Only quotations with shipping terms of F.O.B. Destination or F.O.B Origin will be accepted. Shipping terms of Ex Works (EXW) or Incoterms 2020 (to include but not limited to DAP Incoterms 2020 and FCA, Incoterms 2020) will not be accepted.



The closing date for this intent to award notice is July 24, 2025 at 4:00 pm EST.  Point of contact for this intent to award notice is Allison.T.Meads@uscg.mil. Please indicate 70Z03825QW0000101 in the subject line.

Solicitation Title: Request for Information (RFI) for Launch Equipment Test Facility (LETF)
Description Text:
Amendment 03:  DUE DATE FOR RFI RESPONSES IS EXTENDED TO JULY 25, 2025, and Q&A provided.

This amendment changes the due date from July 18, 2025, to July 25, 2025.

NASA Responses to Industry Questions are attached.



Amendment 02:  THE DUE DATE FOR RFI RESPONSES IS EXTENDED TO JULY 18, 2025. 

This amendment changes the due date from July 11, 2025, to July 18, 2025.

NASA Responses to Industry Questions will be posted this week.



Amendment 01:  AN ADDITIONAL INDUSTRY DAY OPPORTUNITY IS SET FOR TUESDAY, JULY 1, 2025

Interested parties are required to provide written requests NLT June 27, 2025, to Christina.L.Williams@nasa.gov. 

Reference “Industry Day, RFI-KSC-LETF-2025” in the subject line and include the names and e-mail addresses for all participants. 

A confirmation e-mail will be sent to participants with details regarding Industry Day upon receipt of written requests.



**SEE ATTACHMENTS FOR FULL OPPORTUNITY INFORMATION**

NASA’s John F. Kennedy Space Center (KSC) is the world’s premier spaceport. The KSC Master Plan (https://masterplan.ksc.nasa.gov/) addresses both U.S. Government and commercial launch activities at KSC. Periodically, the Spaceport Development Division conducts market research to seek industry interest on specific aspects of the KSC Master Plan.

This Request for Information (RFI) is soliciting interest for potential utilization of services at KSC by entities interested in using the Launch Equipment Test Facility (LETF). NASA is interested in potential operational concepts for partial areas of the facility or the entire facility operations.

The LETF has the capability to test full scale launch hardware, Ground to Flight Umbilical Interface Testing (pneumatic, electrical, instrumentation, cryogenic systems), Vehicle Motion Simulators (VMS) 4-axis, 600 Ton proof-loading test fixture, simulated launch towers, Facility Cryogenic System (liquid nitrogen or liquid hydrogen capability), Water Flow Test Loop, Vehicle Simulation 2-Axis Motion Fixture, Vehicle Support Post 2-Axis load test fixture, Data Acquisition System, Mobile Instrumentation and Data Acquisition System, Control Room, High Speed / Low Speed Video Systems, Hazardous Gas Detection System, Instrumentation and Data Acquisition System Laboratory, Ground Support Equipment Integration Testbed (GSEITB), Electrical / Instrumentation Cable Fabrication and Mold Shop, Pneumatics Shop, Machine and Weld Shop, and the High Bay area for assembly, integration and localized testing.

**SEE ATTACHMENTS FOR FULL OPPORTUNITY INFORMATION**

NAICS Title: Engineering Services

Description Text:
The United States Air Force (USAF), in collaboration with the General Services Administration (GSA), is conducting market research to explore potential business sources for providing systems engineering and integration services. This initiative is part of a broader effort by the Department of the Air Force's Program Executive Office for Command, Control, Communications & Battle Management (C3BM) to enhance mission planning capabilities. The focus is on developing and maintaining advanced Mission Planning Systems (MPS) that support a wide range of Department of Defense (DoD) platforms by leveraging technical solutions and business practices.

The primary work involves supporting both U.S. and Foreign Military Sales platforms through system engineering and integration tasks related to MPS sustainment, modernization, architecture upgrades, security patches, and cybersecurity. The scope also includes integrating these systems with other DAF Battle Network efforts to ensure seamless operation across various military branches. A key aspect of this work is enabling Agile software development through Development Security Operations (DevSecOps), allowing rapid adaptation to changing requirements in mission planning processes.

Moreover, this initiative aims to deliver integrated and interoperable mission planning capabilities that are crucial for optimizing flight routes, managing weaponry and fuel logistics, assessing threats, and conducting dynamic in-flight re-planning. The Systems Engineering and Integration Contractor will play a vital role in providing infrastructure support across the Mission Planning Enterprise. This includes access to secure networks like SIPRNet & JWICS to ensure that U.S. warfighters have reliable tools at their disposal for effective mission execution.
NAICS Title: Engineering Services
Place of Performance Street Address: FEDERAL ACQUISITION SERVICE

Solicitation Title: Aviation Weather Technical and Engineering Support
Description Text:
1. Introduction/Purpose

The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has an Aviation Weather Technical and Engineering Support Services requirement as outlined in the attached Draft Statement of Work (SOW) for the William J. Hughes Technical Center in Atlantic City, NJ. This requirement is anticipated to be an indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity (IDIQ), time and materials (T&M) procurement for a period of 5 years (one (1) year base period and four (4) 1-year periods thereafter). Support services are estimated to commence in Fall 2026. The purpose of this market survey announcement is to solicit capability statements from interested companies.

2. Incumbent Contractor (if applicable)

The incumbent contractor is Basic Commerce and Industries, Inc. (BCI) of Morristown, NJ, and the current contract number is 692M15-22-D-00003.

3. Nature of Competition

The acquisition strategy for this procurement has not been determined. The results of this market survey will be used as a determining factor in deciding on the level of competition.

Please note that based on the FAA’s Acquisition Management System Policy at 3.2.1.2.3, the use of agency wide contract/procurement vehicles must be used to the maximum extent possible. The responses to this announcement will be used as a determining factor regarding whether the use of an existing agency contract/procurement vehicle is appropriate.

Potential sources are cautioned that no further announcement may be made if an existing agency wide contract/procurement vehicle is utilized for this requirement.

4. Standard Language 

(a) This is not a Screening Information Request or Request for Proposals of any kind;

(b) The FAA is not seeking or accepting unsolicited proposals;

(c) The FAA will not pay for any information received or costs incurred in preparing the response to the market survey; and

(d) Any costs associated with the market survey submittals are solely at the interested vendor’s expense.

(e) Vendors will not be notified of the results of this survey or results of information submitted;

(f) The responses to this market survey will be used for informational purposes only and will not be released, except as required under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) or any other applicable law or regulation. Proprietary information will be protected only if marked as such. Therefore, any confidential or proprietary information submitted in response to this announcement must be explicitly and conspicuously marked by the vendor. Such appropriately marked information will not be disclosed outside of the acquisition team; and,

(g) If the FAA decides to conduct an open competition, it may limit the competition to only those vendors who responded to this market survey. However, not responding to this announcement does not preclude participation in any future Screening Information Request or Request for Proposal if any is issued

(h) This announcement is not intended to guarantee procurement of a service, and will not be construed as a commitment by the Government to enter into a contract. Thus, this notice does not commit the FAA or the U.S. Government to contract for any supply or service.

(i) Exclusive responsibility for source selection decision remains with the FAA.

5. North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code

The projected NAICS code for this requirement is 541330 (Engineering Services) with an applicable size standard of $16,500,000.

6. Submittal Requirements for Market Survey

Interested companies should submit a response, not to exceed 5 pages in length, that contains the following information:

(a) Capability Statement – Interested firms are requested to submit a summary of its firm’s capability in meeting the FAA’s requirement as described in the attached Draft SOW. Examples of your firm’s recent corporate experience (within the last 5 years) in performing similar work must be provided. Please include any additional information to assist the FAA in planning the acquisition strategy, such as if you possess a current FAA wide contract/procurement vehicle (such as an Electronic Federal Aviation Administration Accelerated and Simplified Task (eFAST) Master Ordering Agreement (MOA) and its award number).  Also, include your firm’s business classification size.

(b) Statement on whether or not the required services are commercially available in accordance with the definition of ‘commercial item’ in AMS Policy T3.2.1; Appendix C.  If services are deemed non-commercial, companies are requested to provide an explanation as to what delineates them as non-commercial.

7. Delivery of Submittals

All submittals must be received via email to the Contracting Officer, Jennifer Ferrara at Jennifer.ferrara@faa.gov  with a copy provided to Contracting Officer Stephen Jenniss at Stephen.jenniss@faa.gov 5 PM (EDT) on 08/05/2025. All questions regarding this market survey must be submitted via email to Jenniffer Ferrara with a copy provided to Stephen Jenniss no later than 07/29/2025.

The United States Coast Guard (USCG), Aviation Logistics Center (ALC), Elizabeth City, NC intends to award on a sole source basis a Firm Fixed-Price Indefinite Delivery Requirements type contract to Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation (Sikorsky, cage code 78286) on an other than full and open competition basis for the procurement of the Automatic Flight Control System (AFCS) Control Panel, hereafter referred to as “Control Panel,” used on the MH-60T Aircraft. The Control Panel will be supplied via issuance of individually funded Delivery Orders. Sikorsky is the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) and the only Naval Supply Weapons Systems Support (NAVSUP WSS) approved source for the procurement of the Control Panel. The contract will consist of one (1), one (1) year Base Period, and if exercised, two (2), one (1) year Option Periods. All parts must have clear traceability to the OEM. Traceability means a clear, complete, documented, and auditable paper trail which traces each step from an OEM or distributor to its current location.

Description Text:
THIS IS NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL - SPECIFICATIONS ARE NOT AVAILABLE. 

THIS NOTICE IS BEING ISSUED TO DETERMINE IF THERE IS SUFFICIENT INTEREST FROM QUALIFIED PRIME CONTRACTORS who are small businesses, HUBZone small businesses, woman owned small business concerns, 8(a) small businesses, or service disabled veteran-owned small businesses and who intend to submit for this solicitation to allow for a set-aside in one (1) of these programs. Interested businesses must submit the following by e-mail to CFLAcquisitions@dot.gov (Attn: Douglas Whitcomb) for receipt by close of business (2 p.m. local Denver time) on July 29, 2025:

(1) A positive statement of your intention to submit a proposal for this solicitation as a Prime Contractor; 

(2) Current socioeconomic small business type(s), if any;

(3) Firms are required to provide a list of their road/bridge construction inspection experience within the last six (6) years where they were a prime or subcontractor for work of similar type and scope. Include contract numbers, titles, locations, and dollar amounts. 

(4) CFLHD uses the STANDARD SPECIFICATION FOR CONSTRUCTION OF ROADS AND BRIDGES ON FEDERAL HIGHWAY PROJECTS (FP). Firms are required to include the number of qualified inspectors and project engineers employed full-time and must demonstrate their ability to satisfactorily accomplish all work items (either in-house or through qualified subcontractors) in accordance with the FP. 

The size of a small business firm includes all parents, subsidiaries, affiliates, etc. Refer to the Code of Federal Regulations 13 CFR 121.103 for information on how the SBA determines affiliation and 13 CFR 121.108 regarding the penalties for misrepresentation of size status. All firms should be certified in SAM. 

PROJECT DETAILS:

The Federal Highway Administration, Central Federal Lands Highway Division (CFLHD), anticipates soliciting and awarding multiple Indefinite Delivery, Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contracts for non-personal construction project management, inspection and administrative support services for all phases of a construction project.

CFLHD provides engineering and construction services on projects in the states of Arizona, California, Colorado, Hawaii, Kansas, Nebraska, Nevada, New Mexico, North Dakota, Oklahoma, South Dakota, Texas, Utah, and Wyoming on behalf of Federal Land Management Agencies and other Agencies.  This work will generally be performed at the project location and include all duties associated with construction management, oversight, inspection, administration, and other transportation improvement project related services associated with the construction of federally funded road projects accommodating the needs of various Federal and local agencies such as the National Park Service (NPS); USDA Forest Service (Forest Service); U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS); Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA) and Tribal Governments; Bureau of Land Management (BLM); Department of Defense (DOD); U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE); and the Bureau of Reclamation (BOR)s. Projects are typically located in environmentally sensitive, remote locations with terrain ranging from mountainous to desert. 

This procurement is being solicited to A-E firms licensed and registered within one or more of the aforementioned states served by CFLHD with the capacity to provide construction inspection and administration personnel to projects in any of the aforementioned states on short notice (2 - 4 weeks). Firms are required to provide a list of their highway/bridge construction inspection experience within the last six (6) years where they were the prime or subcontractor for work of similar type and scope. Include contract numbers, titles, locations, and dollar amounts. 

The planned duration for each contract awarded is a total of five (5) years.  Each contract will operate with individually negotiated task orders issued in accordance with the terms of the contract. The small business size standard is $25.5 million. 

In support of onsite construction activities, the primary services work will predominantly consist of consultant onsite personnel, specifically, Project Officer Engineers, Construction Inspectors, Project Managers, Senior Scheduler/Claims Analysts and other engineering and professional services.  The projects include construction work on roadways, bridges, trails and encompass a wide range of work from new work to rehabilitation of existing environments.

The solicitation is anticipated to be available in Summer/Fall 2025 with an anticipated start date of Summer 2026.

Description Text:
The General Services Administration (GSA), on behalf of the Navy's Naval Support Activity Bahrain, is conducting market research to identify potential contractors capable of providing readiness support services for the Commander, Naval Surface Force Atlantic (COMNAVSURFLANT) and Commander, Naval Surface Group Central (COMNAVSURFGRUCENT). COMNAVSURFLANT, established in 1975, plays a crucial role in consolidating various naval forces and maintaining readiness across its fleet. This command oversees more than 70 ships and numerous special mission units that operate across the Atlantic Ocean to the Persian Gulf. The support services sought are essential for maintaining operational efficiency and readiness, especially for Mine Countermeasure (MCM) and Littoral Combat Ships (LCS) deployed in Bahrain.

The contract seeks comprehensive support services that include training, management, engineering support, financial services, and data analysis. Specific tasks outlined in the Performance Work Statement (PWS) include financial support through Defense Travel System administration, senior and junior metrics/data analysis focused on logistics and assessments for LCS Enginemen, maintenance scheduling coordination, engineering training facilitation, IT service desk analysis, as well as program coordination related to government travel credit card analysis. These tasks are critical for ensuring that COMNAVSURFLANT can effectively manage its operations while maintaining high standards of readiness.

Performance will occur at a government facility in Bahrain under strict security requirements. Personnel involved must possess a SECRET clearance or higher due to the classified nature of some tasks. The contractor will be responsible for managing classified materials while adhering to operational security protocols. The objective is to provide seamless support that enhances COMNAVSURFLANT's ability to man, train, equip its forces effectively.

This solicitation represents an important opportunity for contractors with expertise in defense travel systems management and naval operations support. By fulfilling these requirements efficiently and securely at an overseas location like Bahrain—while complying with anti-terrorism force protection measures—the selected contractor will contribute significantly to the strategic objectives of U.S. naval operations in key regions such as the Mediterranean Sea and Persian Gulf.

352.226-4

NOTICE OF INDIAN SMALL BUSINESS ECONOMIC ENTERPRISE SET-ASIDE 

MAR 2022



Under the Buy Indian Act, 25 U.S.C. 47, offers are solicited only from Indian Economic Enterprises (HHSAR 326.606) that are also small business concerns. Any acquisition resulting from this solicitation will be from such a concern. As required by HHSAR §  352.226-7(b), offerors shall include a completed Indian Economic Enterprise Representation form in response to Sources Sought Notices, Request for Information (RFI) and as part of the proposal submission. The Indian Economic Enterprise Representation form, available on the IHS DAP public website ( www.IHS.gov/​DAP ), shall be included in synopses, presolicitation notices, and solicitations for the acquisitions under the Buy Indian Act. Offers received from enterprises that are not both Indian Economic Enterprises and small business concerns will not be considered and will be rejected.

(End of clause)

352.226-6

INDIAN ECONOMIC ENTERPRISE SUBCONTRACTING LIMITATIONS 

MAR 2022



(a) Definitions as used in this clause.

(1) Indian Economic Enterprise means any business activity owned by one or more Indians or Indian Tribes that is established for the purpose of profit provided that: The combined Indian or Indian Tribe ownership must constitute not less than 51 percent of the enterprise; the Indians or Indian Tribes must, together, receive at least a majority of the earnings from the contract; and the management and daily business operations of an enterprise must be controlled by one or more individuals who are Indians. To ensure actual control over the enterprise, the individuals must possess requisite management or technical capabilities directly related to the primary industry in which the enterprise conducts business. The enterprise must meet these requirements throughout the following time periods:

(i) At the time an offer is made in response to a written solicitation;

(ii) At the time of the contract award; and

(iii) During the full term of the contract.

(2) Subcontract means any contract, as defined in FAR subpart 2.1, entered into by a subcontractor to furnish supplies or services for performance of the prime contractor or subcontractor. It includes, but is not limited to, purchase orders, and changes and modifications to purchase orders.

(3) Subcontractor means any supplier, distributor, vendor, or firm that furnishes supplies or services to or for a prime contractor or another subcontractor.

(b) Required Percentages of work by the concern. The contractor must comply with FAR 52.219-14, Limitations on Subcontracting clause in allocating what percentage of work to subcontract. The contractor shall not subcontract work exceeding the subcontract limitations in FAR 52.219-14 to a concern other than a responsible Indian Economic Enterprise.

(c) Any work that an IEE subcontractor does not perform with its own employee shall be considered subcontracted work for the purpose of calculating percentages of subcontract work in accordance with FAR 52.219-14 Limitations on Subcontracting.

(d) Cooperation. The contractor must:

(1) Carry out the requirements of this clause to the fullest extent; and

(2) Cooperate in any study or survey that the CO, Indian Health Service or its agents may conduct to verify the contractor's compliance with this clause.

(e) Incorporation in Subcontracts. The contractor must incorporate the substance of this clause, including this paragraph (e), in all subcontracts for general services, A&E services and construction awarded under this contract.

(End of clause)

352.232-71

ELECTRONIC SUBMISSION OF PAYMENT REQUESTS

FEB 2022




	
	
		
		
			
			
				Definitions.  As used in this clause –
			
			
		
		
	
	




Payment request means a bill, voucher, invoice, or request for contract financing payment with associated supporting documentation.  The payment request must comply with the requirements identified in FAR 32.905(b), “Content of Invoices” and the applicable Payment clause included in this contract.




	
	
		
		
			
			
				Except as provided in paragraph (c) of this clause, the Contractor shall submit payment requests electronically using the Department of Treasury Invoice Processing Platform (IPP) or successor system.  Information regarding IPP, including IPP Customer Support contact information, is available at www.ipp.gov or any successor site.
			
			
		
		
	
	





	
	
		
		
			
			
				The Contractor may submit payment requests using other than IPP only when the Contracting Officer authorizes alternate procedures in writing in accordance with HHS procedures.
			
			
		
		
	
	





	
	
		
		
			
			
				If alternate payment procedures are authorized, the Contractor shall include a copy of the Contracting Officer’s written authorization with each payment request.
			
			
		
		
	
	


(End of Clause)

The following local Indian Health Service, Gallup Service Unit special instructions also apply: 



NAIHS-ACQ-08

CONTRACTING OFFICER’S REPRESENTATIVE

AUG 2022



(a)           Definition. “Contracting Officer’s Representative (COR)” means an individual designated in by the Contracting Officer as authorized personnel responsible for the technical aspects of the contract and serves as technical liaison with the contractor.  The COR is also responsible for the final inspection and acceptance of all deliverables and such other responsibilities as may be specified in the contract.

(b)           Per FAR Subpart 1.602-2(d): The Contracting Officer (CO) determines that this contract requires a Contracting Officer Representative (COR). The Contracting Officer Representative (COR) is: 

TBD at time of award.

(c)           Upon award, the COR will receive a copy of the written designation, specifying the extent of the COR’s authority on behalf of the CO.

(d)          Limitations.  The COR is not authorized to make any commitments or changes that will affect price, quality, quantity, delivery, or any other term or condition of the contract.  Any contractor request for changes shall be referred to the CO directly or through the COR.  No such changes shall be made without the express written prior authorization of the CO. 

(End of Clause)

NAIHS-ACQ-09

UNAUTHORIZED COMMITMENTS 

SEP 2023




	Definitions.




Contracting Officer means a person with the authority to enter into, administer, and/or terminate contracts and make related determination and findings.



Ratification means the act of approving an unauthorized commitment by an official who has the authority to do so.



Unauthorized Commitment (UAC) means an agreement that is not binding solely because the Government representative who made it lacked the authority to enter into that agreement on behalf of the Government.




	Policy.




The Government is not bound by agreements with, or contractual commitments made to, prospective contractors by individuals who do not have delegated contracting authority. Unauthorized commitments do not follow the appropriate process for the expenditure of Government funds. Consequently, the Government may not be able to ratify certain actions, putting a contractor at risk for taking direction from a Federal official other than the contracting officer (see FAR 1.602-1) Government employees responsible for unauthorized commitments are subject to disciplinary action. Contractors perform at their own risk when accepting direction from unauthorized officials. Failure to follow statutory and regulatory processes for the expenditure of Government funds is a very serious matter.




	Procedure.




Any agreement, modification, or change to a contractual agreement made by a government personnel who lack authority will be deemed an unauthorized commitment.  The Government is not liable to the Contractor or under the terms of the contract, financially or otherwise – unless the unauthorized commitment successfully passes the ratification process.



The ratification process does not have any lead time, nor does the Government make any promise that an unauthorized commitment will be ratified and, therefore, the Contractor would be paid.  The Contractor proceeds at its own risk if any of the terms of the contract are altered, changed, or modified without the written concurrence by a Contracting Officer.



(End of Clause)





Offers are due: February 10, 2025 at 5:00 PM MST





For additional information or questions about the solicitation, contact Whitney Shorty, Contract Specialist at 928-725-9806 or whitney.shorty@ihs.gov.

Description Text:
**Amendment 01 is to extend the closing date of this solicitation due to no response received.**

This Special Notice constitutes the only solicitation. A written solicitation will not be issued. Solicitation Number 70Z03825QW0000099 is issued as a Special Notice of Intent to Award to RTX Corporation dba Pratt & Whitney (CAGE Code 52661), for the Repair of APU to support the HC-27J Aircraft:

NSN                           Part Number    Nomenclature       QTY

6120-01-529-1340      4504066B               APU                    1

Any vendor, except the OEM or a Production Approval Holder (PAH), repairing/overhauling/modifying Coast Guard aircraft components MUST be FAA 145 certified and perform at least fifty percent (50%) of the work at their company’s FAA certified facility. Unless otherwise instructed by the Contracting Officer, awards for the repair or overhaul of Coast Guard aircraft repairable components shall only be awarded directly to service vendors who have been deemed fully capable of performing such services by division level command-appointed Coast Guard Engineers or Equipment Specialists. Vendors who do not meet the above stated capability requirement will not be considered and should not respond to this solicitation/ request for quote (RFQ).

Incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2025-01 effective November 12, 2024. The applicable North American Industry Classification Standard (NAICS) Code is 488190.  The small business size standard is $40M.

The following attachments apply to this solicitation:

Attachment A – Terms and Conditions

Attachment B – Statement of Work

Attachment C – Redacted Justification for Other Than Full and Open Competition

It is anticipated that a Sole Source Purchase Order will be awarded as a result of this notice pending the availability of funds. It is the Government’s belief that Pratt & Whitney is the only potential source with access to the required proprietary technical and engineering data to provide the repair of the APU. Concerns having the expertise and required capabilities to provide these parts are invited to submit complete information discussing the same within ten (10) calendar days from this posting. Vendors who do not meet the capability requirement will not be considered. The notice of intent will not be extended or the award delayed for a vendor to submit their data for capability determination or for registration in SAM.gov.

Please note: Only quotations with shipping terms of F.O.B Origin will be accepted. Shipping terms of Ex Works (EXW) or Incoterms 2020 (to include but not limited to DAP Incoterms 2020 and FCA, Incoterms 2020) will not be accepted.

The closing date for this intent to award notice is 16 July 2025 at 12:00 pm EST.  Point of contact for this intent to award notice is Logan.J.Brown3@uscg.mil. Please indicate 70Z03825QW0000099 in the subject line.

Description Text:
THIS IS A SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE/REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (RFI).

Sources Sought: Various Spare Parts utilized on the United States Coast Guard (USCG) MH-65 aircraft.

This is not a request for quote or proposal. This sources sought is for information and planning purposes only and is not to be construed as a commitment by the Government. This is not a solicitation announcement for quotes/proposals and no contract will be awarded from this announcement. This sources sought notice has been issued to survey the market to identify possible sources for consideration. This notice is to assist the USCG in determining potential sources.  All firms responding to this sources sought notice are advised that their response to this notice is not a request to be considered for a contract award.

The USCG, Aviation Logistics Center (ALC), Short Range Recovery (SRR) MH-65 Aircraft Division is conducting market research to identify commercially available market sources capable of providing Various Spare Parts with full traceability to the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM), Airbus Helicopters, France (F0210). Vendors are requested to read the RFI in its entirety to ensure information submittals are complete.

Attachment 1 is a complete listing of the parts, in excel format, titled: “Various Spare Parts”.

All manufacturing data for this requirement is proprietary to the OEM’s.  The USCG does not own, nor can it provide specifications, plans, drawing, or other technical data. 

Responses should include the following:


	Name and address of contractor
	Cage Code
	Point of contact including name, title, phone, and email address
	List of all items that can be provided with full traceability to the OEM
	State whether the business is currently classified as Large, Small, Small Disadvantaged, 8(a), HubZone Small Business, Women Owned, Veteran Owned, or Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small business in terms of the NAICS code 336413
	GSA Contract information if applicable and other information that provides the Coast Guard with a more accurate picture of the potential marketplace for this requirement. The NAICS code is 336413 and the small business size standard is 1,250. 


After the review of the responses to this sources sought announcement, and if the USCG still plans to proceed with the acquisition, a solicitation announcement will be published on the SAM.gov website. Responses to this sources sought synopsis are not adequate responses to any future announcement. All interested offerors will have to respond to the solicitation in addition to responding to this sources sought synopsis. Responses to this sources sought synopsis are NOT a request to be added to a prospective offerors list or to receive a copy of the solicitation. Reimbursement will not be made for any costs associated with providing information in response to this announcement and any follow-up information requests.

Closing date and time for receipt of response is 31 July 2025 at 2:00 PM EDT. Telephone responses will not be accepted.  Responses should be submitted to Elaina.M.Price@uscg.mil.  Please indicate 70Z03825IB0000021 in the subject line.

Description Text:
The United States General Services Administration (GSA), on behalf of the United States Air Force (USAF), is conducting market research to support the United States Strategic Command's (USSTRATCOM) Intelligence Directorate (J2) in enhancing its spatial analysis capabilities. The primary goal of this initiative is to provide USSTRATCOM with a comprehensive understanding of potential adversaries' strategic weapons, which is crucial for informing operational plans and ensuring effective decision-making by the Command's leadership and the National Command Authority. This effort requires extensive collaboration with partners across the Intelligence Community (IC) and Department of Defense (DoD) and aims to develop a secure, scalable Geographic Information System (GIS) solution for spatial analysis, geospatial data management, and web-based GIS application development.

The scope of work outlined in the Performance Work Statement (PWS) involves providing cartographic and spatial analysis support to USSTRATCOM J2. The contractor will employ GIS expertise to identify, analyze, and depict intelligence issues spatially using ArcGIS Enterprise software. Responsibilities include developing databases, creating custom maps, charts, graphics, and leveraging other DoD visualization capabilities as needed. Additionally, contractors are expected to have experience with installation, configuration, operation, and limitations of ArcGIS Enterprise while ensuring compliance with DoD security standards.

The objective is for contractors to assist USSTRATCOM J2 by providing Subject Matter Expert (SME) GIS support that enhances the Command's understanding of adversaries' strategic weapons. This includes integrating and maintaining the existing ArcGIS Enterprise ecosystem while working closely with various DoD stakeholders such as senior leadership and operational units. Contractors may also be required to attend industry conferences and technical exchanges to share expertise on emerging GIS technologies.

Work will primarily be performed at USSTRATCOM headquarters in Offutt AFB, Nebraska; however, during crisis operations or as specified by the Government, tasks may be performed at approved contractor facilities or other designated locations. Key deliverables include studies, assessments, briefings, reports, geospatial products developed in accordance with established processes that meet Government formatting guidelines. Contractors will manage GIS databases and execute production plans based on identified shortfalls impacting mission readiness.

Solicitation Title: USACE  Facilities Management Support/SMS Builder and GFE
Description Text:
The General Services Administration (GSA), on behalf of the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), is conducting market research to identify potential contractors for facilities management support at Picatinny Arsenal, NJ. The primary objective of this contract is to ensure efficient and effective management of facility maintenance activities through the integration and utilization of the General Fund Enterprise Business System (GFEBS) and SMS Builder. This initiative aims to enhance operational efficiency, improve data accuracy, and facilitate informed decision-making regarding facility maintenance and capital improvement projects.

The scope of work includes several key tasks aimed at enhancing facilities management operations. Task 1 focuses on Contract Data Requirements, where the contractor is responsible for preparing Monthly Status Reports (MSR). These reports will provide a comprehensive overview of task progress, unresolved issues, meetings conducted, and any schedule changes. The contractor must ensure that critical issues are promptly communicated to relevant government personnel. This task ensures transparency and accountability in project execution.

Task 2 involves Facilities Management Support with a strong emphasis on GFEBS Plant Maintenance. The contractor will be granted access to GFEBS for managing work orders, collecting work data, and analyzing equipment information. This data will be used collaboratively with government stakeholders to develop an Annual Work Plan and prioritize capital improvement efforts. Additionally, the contractor is responsible for providing GFEBS training to Directorate of Public Works (DPW) staff as needed, ensuring that personnel are proficient in using the system for daily operations such as entering Direct Maintenance Orders (DMOs), Preventive Maintenance Orders (PMOs), Planned Work Orders (PWOs), and Other Work Orders (OWOs).

Furthermore, the contractor must implement quality control procedures on all GFEBS data entries and conduct regular analysis based on system data to generate reports requested by the Contracting Officer's Representative (COR). Collaboration with other DPW divisions is essential for process improvement initiatives aimed at developing best practices within facilities management operations. All records generated by the contractor during this contract are considered government property and must be made available upon request by authorized representatives.
